meanings.definition: Soaked with liquid; wet or damp.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the ground became soggier.
meanings.sent2: Her shoes were soggier after stepping in the puddle.
meanings.sent3: The soggier the sponge, the better it cleans!
meanings.sent4: The soggier the bread, the more delicious the French toast.
meanings.sent5: The soggier the towel, the less effective it is at drying.

meanings.definition: Having a soft, mushy texture due to being wet.
meanings.sent1: The soggier banana was easier to mash.
meanings.sent2: The cereal became soggier as it sat in the milk.
meanings.sent3: The soggier the sandcastle, the easier it is to sculpt.
meanings.sent4: Her mood grew soggier as the rainy day continued.
meanings.sent5: The soggier the paper, the harder it is to write on.

meanings.definition: Becoming less firm or solid due to absorbing moisture.
meanings.sent1: The cookies turned soggier after being left out.
meanings.sent2: The cardboard box became soggier in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The soggier the clay, the more pliable it becomes.
meanings.sent4: His resolve grew soggier as the challenges piled up.
meanings.sent5: The soggier the wood, the easier it is to carve.
